body_html:
Here is the example of this BatchNormalization node.
It comes from the official onnx model zoo.
https://github.com/onnx/models/tree/master/models/image_classification/resnet
https://s3.amazonaws.com/onnx-model-zoo/resnet/resnet18v1/resnet18v1.tar.gz

This node contains the caffe2's unhandled attribute "spatial".
From the definition https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/master/docs/Operators.md#batchnormalization ,
we could remove the spatial attribute when it equals to 1.

node {
    input: "resnetv15_conv0_fwd"
    input: "resnetv15_batchnorm0_gamma"
    input: "resnetv15_batchnorm0_beta"
    input: "resnetv15_batchnorm0_running_mean"
    input: "resnetv15_batchnorm0_running_var"
    output: "resnetv15_batchnorm0_fwd"
    name: "resnetv15_batchnorm0_fwd"
    op_type: "BatchNormalization"
    attribute {name: "epsilon" f: 1e-05 type: FLOAT }
    attribute { name: "momentum" f: 0.9 type: FLOAT }
    attribute { name: "spatial" i: 1 type: INT }
}
body_text:
Here is the example of this BatchNormalization node.
It comes from the official onnx model zoo.
https://github.com/onnx/models/tree/master/models/image_classification/resnet
https://s3.amazonaws.com/onnx-model-zoo/resnet/resnet18v1/resnet18v1.tar.gz
This node contains the caffe2's unhandled attribute "spatial".
From the definition https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/master/docs/Operators.md#batchnormalization ,
we could remove the spatial attribute when it equals to 1.
node {
    input: "resnetv15_conv0_fwd"
    input: "resnetv15_batchnorm0_gamma"
    input: "resnetv15_batchnorm0_beta"
    input: "resnetv15_batchnorm0_running_mean"
    input: "resnetv15_batchnorm0_running_var"
    output: "resnetv15_batchnorm0_fwd"
    name: "resnetv15_batchnorm0_fwd"
    op_type: "BatchNormalization"
    attribute {name: "epsilon" f: 1e-05 type: FLOAT }
    attribute { name: "momentum" f: 0.9 type: FLOAT }
    attribute { name: "spatial" i: 1 type: INT }
}
body:
Here is the example of this BatchNormalization node.
It comes from the official onnx model zoo.
https://github.com/onnx/models/tree/master/models/image_classification/resnet
https://s3.amazonaws.com/onnx-model-zoo/resnet/resnet18v1/resnet18v1.tar.gz

This node contains the caffe2's unhandled attribute "spatial".
From the definition https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/master/docs/Operators.md#batchnormalization ,
we could remove the spatial attribute when it equals to 1.

```
node {
    input: "resnetv15_conv0_fwd"
    input: "resnetv15_batchnorm0_gamma"
    input: "resnetv15_batchnorm0_beta"
    input: "resnetv15_batchnorm0_running_mean"
    input: "resnetv15_batchnorm0_running_var"
    output: "resnetv15_batchnorm0_fwd"
    name: "resnetv15_batchnorm0_fwd"
    op_type: "BatchNormalization"
    attribute {name: "epsilon" f: 1e-05 type: FLOAT }
    attribute { name: "momentum" f: 0.9 type: FLOAT }
    attribute { name: "spatial" i: 1 type: INT }
}
```
